pullRequest.title: fix #1995 Let exception handler deal with errors in Mono.subscribe
pullRequest.bodyText: When an error handler is provided to Mono.subscribe(), let it handle the error instead of dropping threw Operators.onErrorDropped

nodes.bodyText: this looks pretty much aligned with what is done in LambdaSubscriber#onNext, taking into account the fact that for Mono it already cancels the subscription (and calls completeConsumer on top of that). that said, maybe the only thing missing vs the flux version is Exceptions.throwIfFatal(t)

I would keep at least one additional test where the errorHolder::set is omitted, to demonstrate that if there is no error consumer, the exception in nextConsumer bubbles up wrapped in an ErrorCallbackNotImplemented exception.

eh sorry for the back and forth. now the test fails because obviously no error handler == ErrorCallbackNotImplemented. So the assertion should A) check that the exception satisfies the Exceptions.isErrorCallbackNotImplemented Predicate and B) that its cause is the IllegalArgumentException.
the starting point of the assertion should thus be the more generic assertThatExceptionOfType(RuntimeException.class).isThrownBy(() -> ....
